messages.subject: Re: Things for doubters to read
messages.msgSnippet: And, in book form, it is much easier to strew than Sandra s website. Much, much easier. Schuyler
messages.messageBody:
And, in book form, it is much easier to strew than Sandra's website.
Much, much easier.

Schuyler

--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Dodd <Sandra@...> wrote:
>
>
> On Feb 21, 2006, at 9:17 PM, Kim H wrote:
>
> > I was just wondering whether the Puddles book of articles are
> > different to the articles on your website?
>
>
> There are more of them. There are photos and illustrations not on
> the website. There was a longer version of the first big interview
> in the book than online, but a little while back I put the longer
> version there too.
>
> But even those who had read or tried to read all my articles will see
> some they hadn't seen before.
>
> Sandra
>

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Things for doubters to read
messages.msgSnippet: ... There are more of them.  There are photos and illustrations not on the website.  There was a  longer version of the first big interview in the book than
messages.messageBody:
On Feb 21, 2006, at 9:17 PM, Kim H wrote:

> I was just wondering whether the Puddles book of articles are
> different to the articles on your website?


There are more of them. There are photos and illustrations not on
the website. There was a longer version of the first big interview
in the book than online, but a little while back I put the longer
version there too.

But even those who had read or tried to read all my articles will see
some they hadn't seen before.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Things for doubters to read
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Sandra, I was just wondering whether the Puddles book of articles are different to the articles on your website? Thanks so much Kim ... From: Sandra Dodd
messages.messageBody:
Hi Sandra,

I was just wondering whether the Puddles book of articles are different to the articles on your website?

Thanks so much
Kim
----- Original Message -----
From: Sandra Dodd
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com ; AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, February 21, 2006 12:31 PM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] Things for doubters to read


Sorry for duplicates to some of the AlwaysLearning readers.

I have cause to sell my remaining book stock, and some of you have
said you wanted to get a copy of Moving a Puddle for friends or
relatives. This would be a good time to do that. Write to me,
Sandra@... if you've been meaning to buy one but
haven't. Thanks.

The book is described here:
http://sandradodd.com/puddlebook

For people who already have this, that page also has a link to Rue
Kream's book.
Some people who won't read webpages, or consider webages to be less
"real," books of real paper sometime carry more weight (physically,
literally <g>).

For those who are fine with websites and want to see what's new on
mine, the last several newly-unveiled or in-progress pages are linked
here:
http://sandradodd.com/blog
also there are links to some other people's unschooling pages



Sandra


SPONSORED LINKS Attachment parenting John holt Parenting magazine
Single parenting


------------------------------------------------------------------------------
YAHOO! GROUPS LINKS

a.. Visit your group "AlwaysLearning" on the web.

b.. To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
AlwaysLearning-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com

c.. Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms of Service.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------
